Government | Surfside Beach, SC Skip to Main Content Create a Website Account - Manage notification subscriptions, save form progress and more. Website Sign In Government Services Business Floodplain VISITORS I Want To Search Home Government Government Surfside Beach is a "Council Form" of government with seven members on the Town Council, including the mayor. The mayor presides over council meetings, performs ceremonial duties, calls special meetings, acts as the informational liaison to the governor in times of emergency, and acts and votes as a member of the council. The mayor has no additional statutory authority beyond that of other councilmembers. The Council appoints the Administrator and oversees all aspects of town business and operations. See a Town Organizational Chart (PDF) . To view a map of the 2 square miles incorporated, the Town of Surfside Beach, click HERE Version OptionsGovernmentHeadline . 9 1 1 2 Agendas & Minutes Access easily searchable meeting agendas and minutes for various boards, commissions, and committees. Committees Our committees play a pivotal role in our Town governance to achieve our vision. Departments Read about the various departments of the government of Surfside Beach. Employment The Town of Surfside Beach maintains a policy of Equal Employment Opportunity and, therefore, does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Ordinances The official Town Code of Ordinances is maintained in the Town Clerk's Office. SC Government Visit the official website of the State of South Carolina. SCIWAY SCIWAY is South Carolina's "front door": the largest and most comprehensive directory of South Carolina information on the Internet. Town Council Read about the Town Council. We Would Love To Connect With You… If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to contact us through the contact form. You can also reach us by email or phone from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. CST, Monday through Friday. Click on one of the forms below and we will get back to you promptly . Town of Melville | (337) 623-4226 | Melville, LA (337) 623-4226 Town of Melville Home Administration Resources Community Events Contact Us Contact Us Learn More About Us! Louisiana’s Small Town with Big Fishing! The Town of Melville is the Louisiana town that is known for its catfish fishing as well as its small-town charm. We’re a community of just under 2,000 people who love our town and are proud of living here. If you are interested in learning more about Melville, LA, please send us an inquiry using the contact form below. Don’t miss our Community Events page! That’s where you’ll find listings for all the fun happenings that take place in Melville every year. Thanks for visiting our website—we hope you’ll drop by to see us in person! To report a gas-related issue call the Town Hall of Melville Monday - Friday 8:30 AM – 4:00 PM at (337) 623-4226. After Hours call the Melville Police Department at (337) 623-5777 or call 911.The LA One-Call Center phone number is 811. Customers should report gas leaks or other gas related information to Town of Melville. Town of Melville Melville, LA (337) 623-4226 Town of Melville, LA Business Hours Mon - Fri 8:30 am - 4:00 pm Sat - Sun Closed Send Us a Message Send Us a Message Name*: Email*: Phone*: Message: Your message has been sent. Your message could not be sent. Use our contact form to reach out today! Get in touch with us! Learn More About Us!
